Hi, I have a question here about Theme Node.js Watch Command :slightly_smiling_face:
Since I changed my Notebook to Mac when I run the Watch Command all the files in my theme folder uploads to HubSpot before activating the Watch Command. This was not happening in PC.
Another thing that I noticed is that now I need to use “*npx* hs watch local-folder hubs-theme-folder”
In PC I just used HS without NPX … Could you please help me figured out if I something wrong here? Thanks.

Hi guys! Not sure if this is the right channel. But do you know a way to display blog post name and blog author name  in a blog template without using the HubSpot “Blog Content” module? I  can see that `{{content_name}}`  is used in the blog post template, but I would like to use that in a custom module in my blog template - is that possible? If not, is it possible to customize the blog content module locally in a way?

Hi
Yes it is possible. Please confirm you want to use in listing template or on single post template.
just adding that to a custom module? thats great!

Hi guys!
Is it possible to customize the tags appearing on the tags field of a blog post editor? Our company has about 4 blog interfaces, but all the tags appear in all the posts editors, so, we need to divide the tags appearing on each posts editor based on the blog. Does that makes sense? Is that possible? Any idea?
If that is not possible, I was thinking about creating a field with the options I need on every blog, and based on the selection, add programmatically the tags to the post, but, I haven't found a way to do it.
